parts.text: Place these in Column A to match a description of each breed in Column B. The first one is completed as an example.
Orf

Anaemia
Type of animal affected _______________________________________
Viral pneumonia
Grass tetany

context: Give a scientific reason in each case why the following practices are carried out on Irish farms.

parts.text: Selective herbicide is sprayed on cereal crops.
Beet tops are left to wilt before feeding to animals.
Tail paint is applied to cows.
Lime is regularly spread on soil.
Farm hedges are trimmed only after the first of September.
List four steps the farmer can take to help successful calving.
Give two differences between colostrum and milk.

subparts.text: Describe three ways in which the farmer ensures good hygiene in calf-rearing.
Name two common diseases of calves.
What is the main function of the rumen?
How can the rumen be helped to develop in the young calf?
Name the three other chambers in the stomach.

parts.text:
(i) Name two species of grass commonly sown on Irish farms.
(ii) Clover is used in grass seed mixtures. Give two benefits of clover.

subparts.text: Name two species of grass commonly sown on Irish farms.
Clover is used in grass seed mixtures. Give two benefits of clover.

parts.text:
(i) Draw a labelled diagram to show a paddock grazing system.
(ii) Give two advantages of paddock grazing.

subparts.text: Draw a labelled diagram to show a paddock grazing system.
Give two advantages of paddock grazing.

parts.text: Give two benefits of mixed grazing of cattle and sheep.

(i) What is the main plant nutrient found in CAN?
(ii) Describe an experiment to show the effect of CAN on grass growth.

subparts.text: What is the main plant nutrient found in CAN?
Describe an experiment to show the effect of CAN on grass growth.

parts.text: Silage making involves the activity of anaerobic bacteria.

subparts.text: Explain the term anaerobic.
Name two species of bacteria that may be involved in silage making.
Describe two ways of ensuring anaerobic conditions in the silage pit.
Describe an experiment to show the presence of bacteria in a sample of silage.

parts.text: A number of factors are needed for seeds to germinate.

subparts.text: Explain the term germination.
List three factors needed for germination to take place.
Give two reasons why maize is commonly sown under plastic.
Describe an experiment to investigate the percentage (%) germination in a sample of seeds.

parts.text: Earthworms are very important in the soil.

subparts.text: Name the phylum to which earthworms belong.
List three ways in which earthworms benefit the soil.
Outline two ways by which the farmer can increase earthworm numbers in the soil.
Describe an experiment to show the activity of earthworms in the soil.

parts.text: Concentrates are commonly fed to farm animals.

subparts.text: Name two food nutrients found in concentrates.
Describe the function of each of the nutrients referred to in (i).
Explain the term dry matter (DM) in relation to animal feed.
Describe an experiment to measure the dry matter content of a named animal feed.
